com.soa.workflow.script

Interface Subject


  • public interface Subject
    Represents the caller Subject in a workflow scripted environment.

    You can gain access to an workflow action caller's subject as follows: 

        subject = workflowContext.getCallerSubject();

    From there you can get information about the subject using the same methods as Subject

    This class should properly overload the normal scripted Subject but that is not possible due to the way the constructors of that class are defined. Instead, this class delegates most of its methods to the underlying scripted Subject.

    See Also:
    Subject

    • Method Detail

      • getPrincipals

        Principal[] getPrincipals()
        Returns the list of principals associated with the Subject.
        Returns:
        List of Principals. Overload the normal scripted Subject method so users can determine the type of principals (class name) and access the native Principal methods to access type-specific information in the Principal. For examplem this is needed in order for workflow scripting to determine the caller identity in CM workflows

      • getPublicCredentials

        java.lang.Object[] getPublicCredentials()
        Returns the list of public credentials associated with the Subject. Changes to the list will not be reflected in the subject.
        Returns:
        List of credential Objects.

      • addPublicCredential

        void addPublicCredential(java.lang.Object credential)
        Adds a public credential to the subject.
        Parameters:
        credential - Credential to add (see BST, X509Certificate, Name, SAML1, SAML2)

      • addPrivateCredential

        void addPrivateCredential(java.lang.Object credential)
        Adds a private credential to the subject.
        Parameters:
        credential - Credential to add (see Password

      • removePublicCredential

        void removePublicCredential(java.lang.Object credential)
        Removes a public credential from the subject.
        Parameters:
        credential - Credential to remove.

      • getCertificateChain

        java.security.cert.X509Certificate[] getCertificateChain()
        Returns the chain of X.509 certificates associated with the Subject. Changes to the list will not be reflected in the subject.
        Returns:
        X509Certificate[]

      • getBST

        BST getBST(java.lang.String type)
        Returns the Binary Security Token (BST) public credential with the given type associated with the subject (if any).
        Parameters:
        type - String URI representing the type of BST public credential to return.
        Returns:
        BST of the given type, null if not present.

      • getInputName

        Name getInputName()
        Returns the Name public credential public credential associated with the subject (if any). Note this credential is an unauthenticated name. To obtain the authenticated name of the subject use getPrincipals().
        Returns:
        Unauthenticated Name public credential, null if not present.

      • getSAML1

        SAML1 getSAML1()
        Returns the SAML1 public credential public credential associated with the subject (if any).
        Returns:
        SAML1 public credential, null if not present.

      • getSAML2

        SAML2 getSAML2()
        Returns the SAML2 public credential public credential associated with the subject (if any).
        Returns:
        SAML2 public credential, null if not present.
